fairpipes package#

fairpipes.pipelines#

fairpipes.pipelines.basic_fairness_assessment(model, X_test, y_test, protected_attribute, mutation_ratio=0, nb_iter=100) → dict[source]#

Basic fairness pipeline.

Make X_test from fairpipes.operators column_shuffle, column_dropping, redistribution, new_class mutants

Compute model predictions for X_test and mutants.

Compute metrics from fairlearn.metrics demographic_parity_difference, equalized_odds_ratio, false_negative_rate, true_negative_rate

Parameters:

  • model – an instance of sklearn.base.BaseEstimator or tensorflow.keras.Model The model should be already trained to allow predictions in the pipeline.

  • X_test – a pandas DataFrame without the target variable.

  • y_test – a pandas Series corresponding to the target

  • protected_attribute – str protected attribute column name

  • mutation_ratio – float, default 0.0 percentage of data to mutate in X_test

  • nb_iter – int, default 100 number of pipeline iterations to make p-value tests

Returns:

python dictionary with operators names as keys and metrics distributions as values

fairpipes.pipelines.multi_mutation_fairness_assessment(model, X_test, y_test, protected_attribute, mutation_ratios, nb_iter=100) → list[source]#

Multi mutation ratio fairness pipeline.

Make a simple mutation pipeline for each mutation ratio in parameter

Parameters:

  • model – an instance of sklearn.base.BaseEstimator or tensorflow.keras.Model The model should be already trained to allow predictions in the pipeline.

  • X_test – a pandas DataFrame without the target variable.

  • y_test – a pandas Series corresponding to the target

  • protected_attribute – str protected attribute column name

  • mutation_ratios – list data percentages to mutate in X_test

  • nb_iter – int, default 100 number of pipeline iterations to make p-value tests

Returns:

list histories of each mutation ratio assessment

fairpipes.operators#

fairpipes.operators.column_killing(dataframe, protected_attribute) → DataFrame[source]#

Column killing operator

Set all values in the column with one of the possible values

Statistically killing the column

Parameters:

  • dataframe – instance of pandas.DataFrame to compute mutation on

  • protected_attribute – str protected attributes column name

Returns:

pandas.Dataframe mutated dataset

fairpipes.operators.column_shuffle(dataframe, protected_attribute, shuffle_ratio=0.0) → DataFrame[source]#

Column shuffling operator

Take a portion of the column of shuffle_ratio*len(dataframe) and randomly make permutations of protected_attributes

Random permutations can generate unchanged values, tol attribute define unchanged values ratio tolerance.

Parameters:

  • dataframe – instance of pandas.DataFrame to compute mutation on

  • protected_attribute – str protected attributes column name

  • shuffle_ratio – float, default 0.0 ratio of the data to mutate

Returns:

pandas.Dataframe mutated dataset

fairpipes.operators.duplication_mutation(dataframe, protected_attribute, duplication_ratio=0.0) → DataFrame[source]#

⚠️ Unusable operator

fairpipes.operators.new_class(dataframe, protected_attribute, mutation_ratio=0.0, new_value='null') → DataFrame[source]#

New class apparition operator

Simulate new value in production data for protected attribute

For numeric columns, new value is max value + 1

For string columns, new value is ‘null’ by default, if you have a ‘null’ class, replace it

Parameters:

  • dataframe – instance of pandas.DataFrame to compute mutation on

  • protected_attribute – str protected attributes column name

  • mutation_ratio – float, default 0.0 proportion of the data to mutate

  • new_value – str, default ‘null’ new value for str columns

Returns:

pandas.Dataframe mutated dataset

fairpipes.operators.redistribution(dataframe, protected_attribute) → DataFrame[source]#

Column occurrence redistribution operator

Compute current value counts and rebalance distribution

Parameters:

  • dataframe – instance of pandas.DataFrame to compute mutation on

  • protected_attribute – str protected attributes column name

Returns:

pandas.Dataframe mutated dataset

fairpipes.utils#

fairpipes.utils.cohend(d1, d2) → float[source]#

Compute Cohen’s d coefficient

Parameters:

  • d1 – list first distribution of floats in range [0, 1]

  • d2 – list second distribution of floats in range [0, 1]

Returns:

Cohen’s d coefficient as float

fairpipes.utils.compute_effect_size(history) → DataFrame[source]#

Compute effect size matrix from history

Parameters:

history – dict history from simple pipeline

Returns:

Dataframe

rows : operators

columns : metrics

Compute p-values matrix from history

history – dict history from simple pipeline

Returns:

Dataframe

rows : operators

columns : metrics

fairpipes.utils.hist_to_dataframe(history) → DataFrame[source]#

Convert history from basic pipeline to pandas dataFrame

Parameters:

history – dict basic pipeline result

Returns:

DataFrame

columns : metrics for each metrics

rows : values over all iterations

fairpipes.utils.make_fig(history, display=True) → None[source]#

Make figure from simple pipeline assessment.

Show distributions for each operator with a combination of a boxplot and violinplot

Parameters:

  • history – dict history from simple pipeline assessment

  • display – bool, default=True indicate if a figure should be displayed

Returns:

None

fairpipes.utils.make_history_figs(history, mutations, title='', save_path='', display=True) → None[source]#

Make figure from simple pipeline assessment.

Show distributions for each operator with subplots.

Each subplot correspond to the average of a metric over all the iteration

Parameters:

  • history – list histories from multiple mutations pipeline assessment

  • mutations – list mutation ratios applied in pipeline

  • title – str, default=’’ figure main title

  • save_path – str, default=’’ figure export path. If empty, figure won’t be saved

  • display – bool, default=True indicates if figure should be displayed

Returns:

None

fairpipes.utils.make_multi_hist_dataframe(histories, mutations) → DataFrame[source]#

Convert history from basic pipeline to pandas dataFrame

Parameters:

  • histories – list histories returned from multiple mutations pipeline

  • mutations – list mutation ration applied in pipeline

Returns:

pandas DataFrame

columns : metrics for each operator and mutation ratio

rows : values over all iterations

fairpipes.utils.make_multi_stats(histories, mutations, model_name='', p_val_save_path='', effect_size_save_path='', display=True) → None[source]#

Compute p-values and effect sizes from multiple mutation pipeline

Parameters:

  • histories – list histories from multiple mutation pipeline

  • mutations – list applied mutation to the pipeline

  • model_name – str, default=’’ assessed model name

  • p_val_save_path – str, default=’’ p-values figure save path. If empty, figure won’t be saved

  • effect_size_save_path – str, default=’’ effect_size figure save path. If empty, figure won’t be saved

  • display – bool, default=True indicate if figure should be displayed

fairpipes.utils.make_stats(history, display=True) → tuple[source]#

Compute p-values and effect sizes from history

Parameters:

  • history – dict history from simple pipeline

  • display – bool, default=True indicate if figure should be displayed

Returns:

p-values : computed p-values matrix

effect_sizes : computed effect_sizes matrix
